clean_content:
Definition / general

* Neuroendocrine neoplasm (may be well differentiated tumor or poorly differentiated carcinoma) that secretes somatostatin, leading to diabetes, cholecystolithiasis, steatorrhea and diarrhea ([J Hepatobiliary Pancreat Sci 2015;22:578](25689919))

Essential features

* Rare functional neuroendocrine neoplasm that secretes somatostatin* May appear microscopically as a well differentiated tumor or a poorly differentiated carcinoma

Terminology

* Also called delta cell tumor

ICD coding

* ICD-10:
  + [C7A.8](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/C00-D49/C7A-C7A/C7A-/C7A.8) - other malignant neuroendocrine tumors+ [E16.8](https://www.icd10data.com/ICD10CM/Codes/E00-E89/E15-E16/E16-/E16.8) - other specified disorders of pancreatic internal secretion

Epidemiology

* Rare; fewer than 1% of gastroenteropancreatic neuroendocrine neoplasms ([J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2008;23:521](17645474))

Sites

* Can occur in the pancreas or in the ampulla / duodenum

Clinical features

* Rare; may be more common in women* May occur in patients with NF1 ([Clin Gastroenterol Hepatol 2009;7:A28](18926936))* Most lesions that stain for somatostatin by immunohistochemistry do not produce somatostatinoma syndrome and arguably do not qualify to be diagnosed as somatostatinomas ([Endocr Relat Cancer 2008;15:229](18310290))* Often metastasizes but still usually has good prognosis

Diagnosis

* Imaging to detect pancreatic mass* Elevated plasma somatostatin levels

Radiology images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreassomatostatinotherimg01.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3365451/figure/fig4/)

CT pancreas mass

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreassomatostatinotherimg02.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3365451/figure/fig5/)

PET with metastases

Case reports

* 57 year old woman with tumors in pancreas and duodenum ([World J Gastroenterol 2009;15:5859](19998510))* 72 year old woman with pancreatic tumor and lymph node metastasis ([JOP 2014;15:66](24413789))* 4 patients with tumor in the pancreas and peripancreas ([Ann R Coll Surg Engl 2011;93:356](21943457))

Treatment

* Surgical resection of primary lesion, if possible* Hepatic metastases can be resected or embolized* Octreotide for metastatic disease

Gross images

*Images hosted on other servers:*  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/pancreassomatostatinotherimg03.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2791282/figure/F2/)

Pancreatic and duodenal tumors

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Some cases are well differentiated neuroendocrine tumor, with nests of monotonous low grade neuroendocrine cells with salt and pepper nuclei and ample amphophilic cytoplasm* Other cases are poorly differentiated neuroendocrine carcinoma, with nests and sheets of mildly / moderately pleomorphic cells with high mitotic rate, small cell or large cell features (no salt and pepper nuclei) and foci of necrosis* May rarely feature psammoma bodies (which are common in duodenal somatostatinomas) ([J Surg Oncol 1995;59:67](7745981))

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Raul S. Gonzalez, M.D.  

[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreassomatostatingonzalez01new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreassomatostatingonzalez01new.jpg)
â€ƒ
[![Missing Image](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreassomatostatingonzalez02new.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreassomatostatingonzalez02new.jpg)

Nests and cords of cells

Positive stains

* **Somatostatin** (though this does not establish the diagnosis)* [Synaptophysin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainssynaptophysin.html), [chromogranin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainschromogranin.html)* **PDX1**, [INSM1](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsinsm1.html) ([Am J Surg Pathol 2012;36:737](22498824))

Negative stains

* [CK7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsck7.html) (8%) ([Am J Surg Pathol 2012;36:737](22498824))* [CDX2](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainscdx2.html)* [BCL10](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsbcl10.html) ([Pathol Int 2013;63:176](23530562))* Nuclear [beta catenin](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsbetacatenin.html) ([World J Gastrointest Onc 2016;8:615](27574554))

Electron microscopy description

* Tumor cells resemble normal D cells ([N Engl J Med 1977;296:963](321960))

Electron microscopy images

AFIP image  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreassomatostatinAFIPEMI1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/pancreassomatostatinAFIPEMI1.jpg)

D cell granules

Sample pathology report

* Pancreas and duodenum, Whipple procedure:
  + Well differentiated neuroendocrine tumor of pancreas (see comment and synoptic report)+ Comment: Based on the patientâ€™s clinical symptoms, this neuroendocrine tumor is best considered a somatostatinoma.

Differential diagnosis

* **Nongastrin secreting pancreatic neuroendocrine tumor or carcinoma**:
  + No histopathologic differences+ Must be determined on clinical grounds

Additional references

* [Best Pract Res Clin Endocrinol Metab 2016;30:3](26971840)
